data.title: Oops... you did it again!
data.text:
Commonly misspelled names

Most of you people are phenomenally stupid and so you won’t ever learn from your many, many mistakes. For instance, there are lots of personal names — including pen names and fictitious characters — that you persistently misspell. I have collected & corrected your false spellings and misconceptions in the following list. These are not just some simple, unique typing errors but obstinate fallacies concerning the correct spelling of these names. Especially the Americans seem to be the true illiterates here. Also, Helsingin Sanomat is an invaluable source of information in this respect.

The Russian names are given in the Finnish forms, however, because the letters Š and Ž and Ё give rise to laziness and misconceptions. In Modern English you don’t have any standard for transliteration, so you cannot make any mistakes either. (The Finnish transliterations are made according to SFS 4900.) — Also, the list is in Finnish alphabetical order, just to annoy foreigners.

You can send me more of these, but you have to find my e-mail address first — hope you can manage that.

Other corrective resources that I have come by:

Difficult names in the sphere of music (document in Finnish) – apprently unavailable Misspelled names in Star Trek – apparently unavailable Searching for Britney Spears? The letters Š and Ž in written Finnish The transliteration of Cyrillic characters The transliteration of Greek characters (document in Finnish) The inflection of French names in Finnish (document in Finnish) Typographic discrimination (my notes on the diacritics & a list).

Last update: March 10th, 2024.

The List
